Package moulton.scalable.utils

Class GridFormatter

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.utils.GridFormatter
public class GridFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
GridFormatter will hold MenuComponents in a grid that can have variable margins, frames, and weights, then will give the coordinate specifications for each component through findCompCoordinates(MenuComponent, Rectangle).
Author:
Matthew Moulton
See Also:
setFrame(String, String), setMargin(String, String), specifyRowWeight(int, double), specifyColumnWeight(int, double)

  • Field Details

    • gridComponents

      protected java.util.HashMap<java.awt.Point,​MenuComponent> gridComponents
      The components that are held at the location they are in the grid. Technically, the maximum x and y are already stored in the map, but for speed, gridDim will keep track of that when components are added or removed.
      See Also:
      addComponent(MenuComponent, int, int), removeComponent(int, int, boolean), getHeldComponents()

    • gridDim

      protected java.awt.Dimension gridDim
      The maximum x and y values of the child components of the grid. This is kept track of as components are added to the grid. At run-time, the grid is split evenly into that many pieces for the x and y axes.

    • xMargin

      protected java.lang.String xMargin
      The width of the x margin. This margin will separate all elements in the x-plane. Defaults to null.
      See Also:
      setMargin(String, String), yMargin

    • yMargin

      protected java.lang.String yMargin
      The height of the y margin. This margin will separate all elements in the y-plane. Defaults to null.
      See Also:
      setMargin(String, String), xMargin

    • xFrame

      protected java.lang.String xFrame
      The width of the outside border. Defaults to null.
      See Also:
      setFrame(String, String), yFrame

    • yFrame

      protected java.lang.String yFrame
      The height of the outside border. Defaults to null.
      See Also:
      setFrame(String, String), xFrame

    • rowWeights

      protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Double> rowWeights
      Holds the values of unique row weights. At default, this map will be empty, and all shown rows will have an implied weight of 1. However, row weights can be specified otherwise with specifyRowWeight(int, double) and they will be saved here. A row with a weight double to another row's weight will have double the width of the latter's row.
      See Also:
      findYWeights(int), getRowWeight(int)

    • colWeights

      protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Double> colWeights
      Holds the values of unique column weights. At default, this map will be empty, and all shown columns will have an implied weight of 1. However, column weights can be specified otherwise with specifyColumnWeight(int, double) and they will be saved here. A column with a weight double to another column's weight will have double the height of the latter's column.
      See Also:
      findXWeights(int), getColWeight(int)

  • Constructor Details

    • GridFormatter

      public GridFormatter()

  • Method Details

    • addComponent

      public void addComponent​(MenuComponent comp, int x, int y)
      Adds a component onto the grid at the specified location. If the location is already taken by another component, comp will replace it. If the location is outside the grid size in gridDim, the grid will expand to include it.
      Parameters:
      comp - the component to add to the grid
      x - the x location of the component
      y - the y location of the component

    • getHeldComponents

      public java.util.Collection<MenuComponent> getHeldComponents()
      Returns the components that are held.
      Returns:
      more formally, returns the components in gridComponents

    • setMargin

      public void setMargin​(java.lang.String xMargin, java.lang.String yMargin)
      Sets the xMargin and yMargin for this panel. The margins will be used to separate components in the grid. Thus the number of marginal dimensions for the width of a panel is (number of x components)-1, where the number of x components is at least one. A null value indicates no margin.
      Parameters:
      xMargin - the width of the margin on the x-axis
      yMargin - the height of the margin on the y-axis

    • setFrame

      public void setFrame​(java.lang.String xFrame, java.lang.String yFrame)
      Sets the xFrame and yFrame for this panel. Unlike margins, the frame will only be on the outside of the panel, not between individual components. A null value indicates no frame.
      Parameters:
      xFrame - the algebraic expression for the width of the frame
      yFrame - the algebraic expression for the height of the frame.

    • removeComponent

      public boolean removeComponent​(int x, int y, boolean resize)
      Deletes the component found at the location (x,y) in gridComponents.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-value of the component to remove
      y - the y-value of the component to remove
      resize - whether the grid should check for a resize after the deletion.
      Returns:
      whether a component was removed at (x,y)

    • findCompCoordinates

      public java.awt.Rectangle findCompCoordinates​(MenuComponent comp, java.awt.Rectangle self)
      Finds the specified component in the grid and returns its pixel coordinates. If it cannot be found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      comp - the component to look for in the grid
      self - the location and dimension of the container component in the render. Ordered as x, y, width, and height.
      Returns:
      the pixel coordinates for the specified component to be rendered. Ordered as x, y, width, and height.

    • specifyRowWeight

      public void specifyRowWeight​(int row, double weight)
      Defines the weight for the given row. A weight of 1 is default and will delete the entry in rowWeights
      Parameters:
      row - the row to set the weight for
      weight - the weight value to set

    • specifyColumnWeight

      public void specifyColumnWeight​(int col, double weight)
      Defines the weight for the given column. A weight of 1 is default and will delete the entry in colWeights
      Parameters:
      col - the column to set the weight for
      weight - the weight value to set

    • findXWeights

      protected double findXWeights​(int maxX)
      Calculates the total weight of the rows until maxX using saved values in colWeights.
      Parameters:
      maxX - the limit where the weight totaling should stop. Using gridDim.width will yield a complete total.
      Returns:
      the total of all column weights

    • findYWeights

      protected double findYWeights​(int maxY)
      Calculates the total weight of the columns until maxY using saved values in rowWeights.
      Parameters:
      maxY - the limit where the weight totaling should stop. Using gridDim.height will yield a complete total.
      Returns:
      the total of all row weights

    • getGridWidth

      public int getGridWidth()
      Returns the width of the saved grid.
      Returns:
      the width of gridDim

    • getGridHeight

      public int getGridHeight()
      Returns the height of the saved grid.
      Returns:
      the height of gridDim

    • getColWeight

      public java.lang.Double getColWeight​(int column)
      Returns the weight of the specified column.
      Parameters:
      column - the column to find the weight of
      Returns:
      the weight of the column specified.

    • getRowWeight

      public java.lang.Double getRowWeight​(int row)
      Returns the weight of the specified row.
      Parameters:
      row - the row to find the weight of
      Returns:
      the weight of the row specified.

    • getAt

      public MenuComponent getAt​(int x, int y)
      Returns the menu component in the grid at the specified location
      Parameters:
      x - the x-value for the component's location
      y - the y-value for the component's location
      Returns:
      the component found at that location. Null is returned if nothing was found there.
